abstract: Norway's $890 billion pension fund will sell off many of its investments in coal, making it largest institution to join growing movement to divest from some fossil fuel stocks; move is likely to add momentum to growing global phenomenon that, while having few economic implications for companies, is laying groundwork for cultural and political discussion around climate change and fossil fuels.
lead_paragraph: Parliament voted to order the nation’s pension fund to shift holdings out of billions of dollars of stock in companies that rely at least 30 percent on coal.

headline.main: Norway Will Divest From Coal in Push Against Climate Change
headline.print_headline: Norway Will Cut Coal Investment in Pension Fund

snippet: Parliament voted to order the nation’s pension fund to shift holdings out of billions of dollars of stock in companies that rely at least 30 percent on coal.
